1.text: Surely there is for silver a source, And a place for the gold they refine;

2.text: Iron from the dust is taken, And from the firm stone brass.

3.text: An end hath he set to darkness, And to all perfection he is searching, A stone of darkness and death-shade.

4.text: A stream hath broken out from a sojourner, Those forgotten of the foot, They were low, from man they wandered.

5.text: The earth! from it cometh forth bread, And its under-part is turned like fire.

6.text: A place of the sapphire are its stones, And it hath dust of gold.

7.text: A path—not known it hath a ravenous fowl, Nor scorched it hath an eye of the kite,

8.text: Nor trodden it have the sons of pride, Not passed over it hath the fierce lion.

9.text: Against the flint he sent forth his hand, He overturned from the root mountains.

10.text: Among rocks, brooks he hath cleaved, And every precious thing hath his eye seen.

11.text: From overflowing floods he hath bound, And the hidden thing bringeth out to light.

12.text: And the wisdom—whence is it found? And where is this, the place of understanding?

13.text: Man hath not known its arrangement, Nor is it found in the land of the living.

14.text: The deep hath said, ‘It is not in me,’ And the sea hath said, ‘It is not with me.’

15.text: Gold is not given for it, Nor is silver weighed—its price.

16.text: It is not valued with pure gold of Ophir, With precious onyx and sapphire,

17.text: Not equal it do gold and crystal, Nor is its exchange a vessel of fine gold.

18.text: Corals and pearl are not remembered, The acquisition of wisdom is above rubies.

19.text: Not equal it doth the topaz of Cush, With pure gold it is not valued.

20.text: And the wisdom—whence doth it come? And where is this, the place of understanding?

21.text: It hath been hid from the eyes of all living. And from the fowl of the heavens It hath been hidden.

22.text: Destruction and death have said: ‘With our ears we have heard its fame.’

23.text: God hath understood its way, And He hath known its place.

24.text: For He to the ends of the earth doth look, Under the whole heavens He doth see,

25.text: To make for the wind a weight, And the waters He meted out in measure.

26.text: In His making for the rain a limit, And a way for the brightness of the voices,

27.text: Then He hath seen and declareth it, He hath prepared it, and also searched it out,

28.text: And He saith to man:—‘Lo, fear of the Lord, that is wisdom, And to turn from evil is understanding.’
